newsitem.title: USA: PETsMART sees Q1 shr $0.05, under forecast.
newsitem.headline: PETsMART sees Q1 shr $0.05, under forecast.

text.p: PETsMART said it expected to report first quarter net income from operations of about $0.05 per share as compared to the Wall Street consensus of $0.08 per share, because of softer sales trends.
The company earned $0.06 per share in the first quarter last year.

Sales trends were below expectations due to unsuccessful advertising activities, a change in customers' preferred treatment of fleas and ticks, and a greater than anticipated reduction in store inventory levels, the company said.
The company said it expected soft sales trend to continue into the second quarter, particularly for flea and tick products.

PETsMART also said it expected comparable store sales for its North American stores to be about seven percent for the quarter and it expected United Kingdom comparable store sales to be about six percent for the same period.

PETsMART President Mark Hansen said: "We continue to be optimistic about our business achieving healthy revenue growth of 25 to 30 percent and earnings growth of 30 to 35 percent over the long term as the company continues to grow its business in both North America and in the United Kingdom."
